unnormalised: ## Flash Sales: Blink and You'll Miss 'Em!
normalised: ## Flash Sales: Blink and You'll Miss 'Em!

unnormalised: Hey everyone, ever felt that rush of adrenaline when you see a "limited time only" offer? That's the magic of flash sales! In the world of retail & e-commerce, they're like Diwali discounts popping up out of nowhere, giving you a fleeting chance to snag something amazing.
normalised: Hey everyone, ever felt that rush of adrenaline when you see a "limited time only" offer? That's the magic of flash sales! In the world of retail or e-commerce, they're like Diwali discounts popping up out of nowhere, giving you a fleeting chance to snag something amazing.

unnormalised: Think of it as a chai break for your wallet. A quick, potent dose of savings before you get back to the grind. From sarees at Nalli Silk to electronics on Flipkart, everyone's doing it. My Auntie Meena in Mumbai got a killer deal on a new Samsung phone last week thanks to one! She's usually so careful with her Rs., but even she couldn't resist.

unnormalised: Why do they work so well? Well, a little bit of FOMO (Fear Of Missing Out) goes a long way. That ticking clock creates a sense of urgency. Plus, retailers often use them to clear out old stock, test the market with new products, or simply drive traffic to their online or physical stores. Imagine a store in Connaught Place offering 70% off on winter coats for just 2 hours! Chaos, right? But profitable chaos.

unnormalised: But remember, a word of caution, friends! Don't get swept up in the hype. Make sure you actually *need* the item and that the price is genuinely good. Research prices beforehand. Just because a banner screams "Discount!" doesn't mean it's a better deal than what you might find elsewhere.
